business.headline: India can become the AI capital of the world: Meta's Sandhya DevanathanSandhya Devanathan, Vice President and Head of India at Meta, discusses the company's AI initiatives, including Meta AI and Llama models.

We are going to be future ready: Priyank Kharge on AI transforming job marketSharing his thoughts on AI creating a job deficit, Priyank Kharge, Minister of IT and Biotechnology of Karnataka said that technological evolution creates new opportunities rather than eliminating them.

Forging the future: CP Gurnani, Aditya Ghosh discuss AI's role in empowering IndiaCP Gurnani highlighted the necessity of blending AI with human capabilities. Aditya Ghosh emphasised the accessibility of AI, calling this era a "magical time" akin to the Industrial Revolution.

Firms using AI to empower workforce likely to excel in future: Professor Das NarayandasSpeaking at the India Today-Business Today AI Conference 2024, during a session titled 'Leadership.Change.AI', he emphasised that organisations focusing on how AI can augment their workforce are likely to emerge as industry leaders.

Paytm share price hits 52-week high today. What's driving the rally?Paytm share price: The stock jumped 3.60% to hit a 52-week high of Rs 990.90 on Friday. At the closing bell, the stock settled 1.89% higher at Rs 974.55.
Sensex, Nifty end flat as RBI maintains status quo on interest ratesThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 56.74 points to end at 81,709.12, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 30.60 points to close at 24,677.80.
Insurance claims denied? Nithin Kamath explains why and what you can doNithin Kamath warns that having insurance doesn't guarantee full claims and lists common rejection reasons.

MCX share price hits Rs 7,000 milestone as stock rallies over 8%The stock has delivered an impressive growth trajectory, with gains of over 100% in the past year, over 300% in the last three years, and more than 500% over the last five years.

Explained: Why Vedanta share price jumped over 6% todayThe surge in stock price follows an announcement from Vedanta Resources Finance II PLC, a subsidiary of VRL, that it had redeemed the full amount of $1.2 billion in bonds due in 2025 but extended to 2028.

RBI MPC: Homebuyers may have to wait till 2025 for EMI reliefThe RBI has kept key lending rates unchanged with Governor Shaktikanta Das explaining the Monetary Policy Committee's (MPC) focus on economic stability.

RBI cuts CRR to 4%: How this liquidity boost will benefit economyThe decision to cut CRR is expected to benefit the banking sector, particularly public sector banks, by lowering the cost of funds and increasing lending capacity.

EPFO extends deadline to activate UAN for ELI scheme. Check final dateThe EPFO has extended the deadline to link UAN and Aadhaar under the ELI scheme to mid-December, aiming to boost job creation with incentives for employees and employers.
RBI MPC announcement: 7 important decisions you should know aboutThe Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy update includes key decisions like CRR reduction, increase in farm loan limits and more.

RBI increases UPI Lite transaction limit: How will you benefit?The RBI has increased transaction limits for UPI Lite, making digital payments more convenient, flexible, and accessible for customers, especially for low-value and offline transactions.

'Our job is…': RBI Governor defends policy amid criticism over lending ratesShaktikanta Das explained that the decision to hold rates stems from a dual focus on managing inflation and supporting growth. He acknowledged the recent rise in inflation, primarily due to food prices, and the moderation in economic growth

What is Cash Reserve Ratio? Understanding RBI's liquidity management toolThe RBI cut the Cash Reserve Ratio (CRR) to 4% on December 6, injecting Rs 1.16 lakh crore into the banking system to boost liquidity, credit flow, and economic growth.
RBI keeps key rates unchanged, cuts CRR to 4%: What it means for stock marketAt 11:23 am, the Sensex was down 13.04 points at 81,752.82, while the Nifty50 declined 12.05 points to trade at 24,695.80.

Lower GDP forecast to CRR boost: 6 key takeaways from RBI MPCThe MPC decided by a 4-2 majority to maintain the policy repo rate at 6.5%. Governor Shaktikanta Das explained that this decision was based on an assessment of the economy and financial conditions.
RBI reduces CRR to 4% for liquidity boost. 3 things to know The RBI MPC has kept the key lending rates unchanged to 6.5% as its focus remains on bringing inflation under control.

RBI keeps key lending rate unchanged at 6.5%, focus remains on tackling inflationRBI MPC: Governor Shaktikanta Das said the Monetary Policy Committee has decided to keep the repo rate unchanged and continue with its neutral stance.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Congress slams Haryana Police's 'barbarity' as farmers blocked at Punjab borderHaryana Police used tear gas and force to halt Punjab farmers' march at the Shambhu border, prompting the Congress to condemn the BJP government's "undemocratic actions".

Notre Dame doors to open once again 5 years after fire: All about grand reopeningNotre Dame Cathedral in Paris will reopen on December 7, following a five-year restoration after the 2019 fire. The cathedral will feature a rebuilt spire, restored interiors, and preserved historical elements.

Row over Parliament seating, INDIA alleges government went back on its wordCongress and Samajwadi Party (SP) have protested changes in Parliament's front-row seat allocations, accusing the BJP-led government of altering the agreed formula.

Big court relief to Ajit Pawar as assets seized in benami case clearedAjit Pawar was granted relief by the Prevention of Benami Property Transactions Appellate Tribunal in Delhi, which dismissed allegations of benami property ownership against him and his family.

Yemeni descendants to agents: Evolution of 'Sheikh marriages' from Nizam eraHyderabad: The roots of such Sheikh marriages in Hyderabad can be traced back to the reign of the Nizams. These short-term contract marriages involve young girls being 'sold' to wealthy sheikhs from Gulf countries.

Google Maps shortcut leaves Bihar family stranded in Karnataka's dense jungleA Bihar family, misled by Google Maps, spent a night trapped in Bheemgad forest before local police rescued them the next morning after they regained their network to seek help.

Mitchell Starc continues pink ball love affair to hurt India on Day 1 Australia vs India, 2nd Test: Mitchell Starc's six-wicket haul and a solid partnership between Marnus Labuschagne and Nathan McSweeney helped Australia bounce back from the Perth hammering and dominate India on Day 1 of the pink-ball Test in Adelaide.

Allu Arjun donates Rs 25 lakh to Hyderabad stampede victim's familyActor Allu Arjun finally broke his silence on the Pushpa 2 stampede tragedy that claimed the life of a 39-year-old woman named Revathi. The actor donated Rs 25 lakh to the victim's family as a 'gesture of goodwill'.

Exclusive: Rana Daggubati talks about Naga Chaitanya-Sobhita's weddingRana Daggubati attended his cousin Naga Chaitanya's wedding to Sobhita Dhulipala in Hyderabad. He shared insights about the celebrations in an exclusive interview with India Today Digital.
University of Bath School of Management: A Leader in Global Business EducationCombining top-ranked MSc programmes with practical knowledge for future corporate leaders.

The Sarita in Devendra Sarita Gangadharrao FadnavisSarita Fadnavis used to take her teenaged son to an RSS sakha in Nagpur every day in the late 80s and early 90s. Sarita, herself a politician, set her son on a course that would give Maharashtra its Chief Minister in Devendra Sarita Gangadharrao Fadnavis.

Who persuaded Eknath Shinde? What Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis saidDevendra Fadnavis, who was sworn in as the Chief Minister for a third term, spoke on a range of topics, from how Eknath Shinde was won over and factors behind Mahayuti's massive mandate.

Cillian Murphy to play Lord Voldemort in upcoming Harry Potter series: ReportSpeculation is rife about the casting of HBO's upcoming Harry Potter series. Cillian Murphy is rumoured to play Voldemort, while casting for Harry, Ron, and Hermoine is underway.

CEO killer unmasked: Suspect snapped while flirting; bottle, phone offer cluesA key breakthrough came from a surveillance photo captured at the hostel the suspect had checked into before the murder, which briefly shows the man's face after he lowered his mask while flirting with a receptionist.

Gutsy Nitish Kumar Reddy turns doubter Sunil Gavaskar into a fanNitish Kumar Reddy silenced critics with a composed knock on Day 1 of the Adelaide Test, emerging as a bright spot in India's batting collapse. The 21-year-old's fearless approach and maturity drew high praise from Sunil Gavaskar, who had initially doubted the all-rounder.

Carrying Rs 50,000 not unusual: Congress leader on cash found in ParliamentJairam Ramesh argued that carrying Rs 50,000 in cash is neither unusual nor suspicious, pointing out that several MPs, including those from the BJP, admitted to carrying a similar amount to the Parliament.

When Pakistani pitch invader ripped Indian captain's shirt, exchanged blowsAmid security concerns, the BCCI had decided against sending the Indian cricket team to Pakistan for the Champions Trophy. During the first Test in Karachi in 1989, a man shouting anti-India slogans invaded the pitch and attacked Indian captain Krishnamachari Srikkanth, ripping his shirt. Another match of the Pakistan tour had to be aborted because of unruly Pakistani fans.
Eyewear trends to watch out for in 2025From smart glasses and lightweight frames to blue-light filtering lenses, eyewear will be all the more a fashion statement

Maruti, Hyundai, Mahindra, MG, Mercedes-Benz, BMW, others to hike car pricesPrice hikes have been necessitated by a rise in input costs and other factors like an increase in commodity prices, higher operational expenses, adverse exchange rates and a jump in logistics costs, according to carmakers.

Pushpa 2 smashes box office records by grossing Rs 294 crore on Day 1Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2: The Rule has created history in Indian cinema by grossing Rs 294 crore worldwide on its opening day. Released on December 5, 2024, it now holds the record for the highest-ever opening day collection.

Photo Essay: The Babri Masjid demolition, 32 years agoA moment that shook India's foundation — when religion, politics, and identity collided at Ayodhya. The Babri Masjid demolition remains a haunting echo of unresolved tensions and enduring divides.

Mocha Mousse, Pantone Colour of the Year 2025: The India editFor the Indian palette, Mocha Mousse is a perfect match! Whether in your wardrobe, home interiors, or makeup, the Pantone Colour of the Year 2025 effortlessly adds a luxe twist to your style.

Mayawati expels party leader for son's marriage with Samajwadi MLA's daughterThe wedding came under further scrutiny after SP chief Akhilesh Yadav recently visited Tribhuvan Dutt's residence in Ambedkar Nagar. Alongside Sagar, Rampur district president Pramod Sagar was also removed from his position.

India can become the AI capital of the world: Sandip Patel, MD, IBM IndiaAt the Business Today-India Today AI Conference 2024, Sandip Patel, managing director of IBM India and South Asia talks about India's role in the AI era, how it can help the common man, and more.

Shreyas Talpade on being the Hindi voice of PushpaShreyas Talpade, the voice behind Allu Arjun's iconic character in the Hindi version of Pushpa, shares his thoughts on the overwhelming response to his dubbing performance.

Cillian Murphy to play Lord Voldemort in upcoming Harry Potter series: ReportSpeculation is rife about the casting of HBO's upcoming Harry Potter series. Cillian Murphy is rumoured to play Voldemort, while casting for Harry, Ron, and Hermoine is underway.

Critics' Choice Awards: Emmy-winning show Shogun leads with 6 nodsThe nominations for Critics' Choice Awards are out and Hiroyuki Sanada's Shogun is leading the list with six nominations. Other strong contenders include Abbott Elementary, Disclaimer, Hacks, and The Penguin.

Citadel Honey Bunny earns Critics' Choice nod, Russo Brothers congratulate teamRaj and DK's Citadel Honey Bunny has been nominated for the Critics Choice Awards, marking a significant achievement for the show. The Russo Brothers have also congratulated the team.

sports.headline: KL Rahul and Shubman showed good intent in Adelaide: PujaraIndia's batting woes continued as Mitchell Starc dismantled the lineup, but KL Rahul and Shubman Gill offered a glimmer of hope with their promising partnership. Day 2 presents a daunting challenge for Rohit Sharma's side to reclaim control.

Sumit Nagal earns direct main-draw entry, Nick Kyrgios returnsAustralian Open 2025: India's Sumit Nagal earned a direct entry into the main draw of the hard-court major. Nick Kyrgios will be making his Grand Slam return since last playing in the US Open 2022.

Pathum Nissanka's 89 steadies Sri Lanka after Kyle Verreynne's 105SA vs SL: Sri Lanka trailed by 116 runs at the close of play on the second day after Pathum Nissanka scored 89. Earlier in the day, Kyle Verreynne guided South Africa with his third Test century.

Angelo Mathews joins elite Sri Lanka club with 8000 Test runs SA vs SL, 1st Test, Day 2: Angelo Mathews became the third Sri Lankan batter after Kumar Sangakkara and Mahela Jayawardene to score 8000 runs in Test cricket.

'Pink ball magician' Mitchell Starc wrestled back momentum for Australia: HaydenMatthew Hayden heaped praise on Mitchell Starc and claimed that the pacer wrestled back the momentum for Australia on Day 1 of the pink-ball Test. Starc picked up 6 wickets to break the back of the Indian batting order.

Jasprit Bumrah not getting enough support big reason to worry for India AUS vs IND: India are on the back-foot in the second Test at the Adelaide Oval after getting bowled out for 180. For them to make a comeback, Jasprit Bumrah needs support from the other bowlers big time.

Ashwin in, Washington Sundar out: ten Doeschate explains Adelaide team callIndia fielding coach Ryan ten Doeschate explained the strategic choice of picking Ravichandran Ashwin over Washington Sundar for the Adelaide Test, citing Ashwin's proven pink-ball record and batting strength as critical factors despite fan criticism over Sundar's exclusion.

Mitchell Starc reveals plan behind Yashasvi Jaiswal's 1st ball Adelaide wicketMitchell Starc revealed the plan behind Yashasvi Jaiswal's first ball dismissal on Day 1 of the pink-ball Test on Friday, December 6. Starc delivered an absolute ripper to dismiss Jaiswal with the very first ball of the match.

India capable of striking back, but bowling needs to be better: Gavaskar AUS vs IND: The legendary Sunil Gavaskar said that India need to work on their bowling to think about making a comeback in their second Test against Australia at the Adelaide Oval. At Stumps on Day 1, Australia trailed by 94 runs with nine wickets in hand.

Nitish Kumar Reddy is still raw, but has a huge ceiling: Ryan ten DoeschateIndia fielding coach Ryan ten Doeschate heaped praise on young all-rounder Nitish Kumar Reddy and claimed that he has a high ceiling in the game. Nitish once again bailed out India from a tough spot and got them to 180 runs in the first innings.

Sunil Gavaskar credits Mitchell Starc for devastating spell vs India   AUS vs IND: In an interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar heaped praise on Mitchell Starc for picking up a six-wicket haul in the first innings of the second Test at the Adelaide Oval. Starc also became the fourth bowler after Glenn McGrath, Shane Warne and Brett Lee to take 350 or more wickets on Australian soil.

Starc also became the fourth bowler after Glenn McGrath, Shane Warne and Brett Lee to take 350 or more wickets on Australian soil.

The 21-year-old's fearless approach and maturity drew high praise from Sunil Gavaskar, who had initially doubted the all-rounder.

JP Duminy steps down as South Africa's white-ball batting coachFormer South Africa all-rounder JP Duminy has stepped down as the batting coach of his national side due to personal reasons after taking the position in March 2023.

India could have batted better, 70-80 runs behind in the end: Cheteshwar PujaraCheteshwar Pujara feels that India could have done better with the bat and ended up being 70-80 runs behind in the end on Day 1 of the pink-ball Test in Adelaide. India suffered a mighty collapse on Friday, December 6.

Virat Kohli sledges Marnus Labuschagne as he faces Bumrah: He's got no clueStar India batter Virat Kohli was seen sledging Marnus Labuschagne and Nathan McSweeney during Day 1 of the second Test in Adelaide.

Jasprit Bumrah turns 31, Sanjana Ganesan drops adorable wish for pacerAUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah's wife Sanjana Ganesan dropped a birthday wish for the Indian pacer, who is currently playing in the Adelaide Test against Australia.

Mohammed Siraj bowls 181.6 kmph? Speed-gun goes horribly wrongA technical glitch clocked Mohammed Siraj's delivery at an impossible 181.6 kmph, sparking humour amidst a challenging Day 1 for India in the Adelaide Test, as Australia ended with a strong 86/1 reply to India's modest 180.

Mitchell Starc continues pink ball love affair to hurt India on Day 1 Australia vs India, 2nd Test: Mitchell Starc's six-wicket haul and a solid partnership between Marnus Labuschagne and Nathan McSweeney helped Australia bounce back from the Perth hammering and dominate India on Day 1 of the pink-ball Test in Adelaide.

Beer snake distracts Labuschagne, irks Siraj in bizarre scenes in AdelaideAUS vs IND: Mohammed Siraj lost his composure after Marnus Labuschagne pulled out of his stance in the 25th over of the Australian innings at the Adelaide Oval.

Jasprit Bumrah turns 31, Sanjana Ganesan drops adorable wish for pacerAUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah's wife Sanjana Ganesan dropped a birthday wish for the Indian pacer, who is currently playing in the Adelaide Test against Australia.

Mohammed Siraj bowls 181.6 kmph? Speed-gun goes horribly wrongA technical glitch clocked Mohammed Siraj's delivery at an impossible 181.6 kmph, sparking humour amidst a challenging Day 1 for India in the Adelaide Test, as Australia ended with a strong 86/1 reply to India's modest 180.

Mitchell Starc continues pink ball love affair to hurt India on Day 1 Australia vs India, 2nd Test: Mitchell Starc's six-wicket haul and a solid partnership between Marnus Labuschagne and Nathan McSweeney helped Australia bounce back from the Perth hammering and dominate India on Day 1 of the pink-ball Test in Adelaide.

Beer snake distracts Labuschagne, irks Siraj in bizarre scenes in AdelaideAUS vs IND: Mohammed Siraj lost his composure after Marnus Labuschagne pulled out of his stance in the 25th over of the Australian innings at the Adelaide Oval.

Sri Lankan Sammi Silva succeeds Jay Shah at Asian Cricket CouncilShammi Silva takes over the Asian Cricket Council presidency, succeeding Jay Shah, who moves to an ICC leadership role. Silva's extensive cricketing and administrative experience positions him to steer Asian cricket through its next phase of growth and development.

NZ vs ENG: Harry Brook labels Wellington hundred his 'favourite' knock so farHarry Brook claimed that his counter-attacking hundred in the Wellington Test is his favourite knock so far in his career. Brook scored 123 runs off 115 deliveries to put England in control of proceedings in the second Test.

Adelaide floodlights go off during pink-ball Test, leave India bowlers frustratedAustralia vs India, 2nd Test: The floodlights at the Adelaide Oval went off twice in an over bowled by Harshit Rana. The young pacer was frustrated at the interruption in play in the evening session on Day 1.

Kyle Verreynne joins AB de Villiers in rare club with 3rd Test century SA vs SL: Kyle Verreynne scored an unbeaten 105 off 133 balls as South Africa made 358 in 103.4 overs in their second Test against Sri Lanka at St George's Park in Gqeberha.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
